oai_dc:dc.dc:title: APPLICATION OF PLASMA VISCOSITY TO ASSESS THE STATUS OF CANCER-PATIENTS
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: RANADE, GG
PUNIYANI, RR
HUILGOL, NG
KHAN, MM
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: blood
cancer
plasma viscosity
non-newtonian
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Cancer is a disease which leads to different systemic changes particularly observed in blood. Plasma viscosity is one of the ways of evaluating such changes. A study of plasma viscosity in oral cancers indicated the status of the disease. In cancer at advanced stage (stage IV), it showed non-Newtonian behaviour. Very high viscosity of plasma at low shear was seen in the patients having poor prognosis.
